messages: e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:38): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, yt?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:44): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: I'm here now
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:45): How many the treebuilders in html5lib support namespaces?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:46): You mean how many of the actual tree formats?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:46): yeah
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:46): minidom, etree
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:46): Dunno about BeautifulSoup
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:46): simpletree can obviously be changed
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:47): What are you planning?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:47): SVG support
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:47): and MathML while I'm at it
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:47): through a shared phase if possible
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:47): I was thinking of doing that on a branch
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:48): that's ok
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:48): oh, you're planning it too?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:48): Well I don't have much time so I don't mind having fewer plans
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:49): my idea was to keep everything case-insensitive
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:50): and handle everything in the phase
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:50): and correct case for the few elements that need it upon node creation
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:50): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: That won't work with SVG as specced though, right?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:50): thinks case sensitivity is easy to add
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:51): yeah, but I'm not sure why case sensitivity is useful for authors
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:51): That seems to require a lot of language-specific knowledge in the parser
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:51): a lot?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:52): Well you need to know which elements are case sensitive in each language.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:53): no, you just need to know that if you find textarea in the SVG context it needs to be inserted as textArea
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:53): Is that the only example in SVG+MathML?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:53): MathML is like HTML, everything lowercase
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:53): SVG has a few elements and attributes with mixed case
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:54): you'd just put those in a frozenset and handle it all when creating an element and adding attributes
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:55): Yeah, I see it could work. I don't know what the right thing to do is though.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:55): I think consistency within text/html has some value, but yeah
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:56): Are you planning to cater for mathml inside html inside SVG inside...
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:56): well, you go out of <svg> when you hit <foreignObject>
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:57): <foreignObject> -> in body phase
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:57): so yes, that would work
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (13:57): MathML has <semantics> to cater for that I believe, but MathML may allow other ways of nesting as well
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:10): somehow, I'm amused by an element named <semantics>
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:11): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, so the main thing I guess is treebuilder support and testsuite support
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:12): and then figuring out if SVG and MathML can share a phase or if different phases would be more appropriate
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:12): hopes for a shared phase
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:13): testsuite support isn't obviously tricky; the main requirement is that we don't have to rewriet our existing tests
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (14:14): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: is that a real proposal?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:14): so modifying the dump format to allow elements in other namespaces with a prefix
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:14): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884, it's a MathML element we were discussing
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (14:14): MathML really has an element called that?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:14): yeah
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:14): it's like SVG <foreignObject>: http://www.w3.org/TR/MathML2/chapter2.html#id.2.1.4
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:15): it's overloaded and very unspecific on how you handle it
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:15): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, a prefix could work I suppose, although it might confuse people...
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:16): Why would they be confused?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:16): <svg> http://www.w3.org/2000/svg
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:16): <svg:svg> ?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:17): because the tagname is actually "svg" in the DOM and not "svg:svg" but I guess it's ok
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:17): hmm. I guess I could improve UI if the front end said SVG element foo instead of element foo from namespace http://www.w3.org/2000/svg
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:17): actually, I prefer something like "| <svg> svg" to make that more clear
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:17): actually that's a good point, <svg>svg is better
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:17): over svg:svg
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:17): you type faster than me :)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:19): we also need to add support for namespaced attributes
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:19): href needs to mapped to xlink:href with xlink bound to the XLink namespace
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:20): I'm afraid this is all for today though, I've to go in half an hour
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:21): has to do other stuff this afternoon as well
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:39): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, maybe we should do this as part of the HTML WG meeting if there's some time
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (14:39): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, some hacking might be a nice distraction
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:39): Sounds good
